results.title: Speedball for girls
results.brief_description: An introduction to the game of speedball. Explains players’ positions on the field, the rules of the game, techniques in developing team co-operation and individual skills - kicking, juggling, volleying, passing and receiving.

results.title: Speed the scrap [Short version]
results.creator_credit: Frank Green, Ace Films and British Iron and Steel Federation
results.brief_description: Emphasises the fact the Britain is becoming more dependent upon scrap metal to maintain her output of iron and steel. Iron ore deposits in the Midlands and imported ore from Africa provide insufficient supplies for new steel; over half the iron and steel produced in the United Kingdom is made from scrap. shows conversion of scrap to new steel in electric carbon-arc furnaces; by-product of process is slag, used as fertiliser.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Frank Green, Ace Films and British Iron and Steel Federation

results.title: Speed scene: the problem of amphetamine abuse
results.brief_description: Presents evidence against the use of amphetamines in any form other than for medical purposes. Discusses psychological dependency on these drugs and how it often leads to other more dangerous, addictive drugs. Notes the most malignant form of amphetamine, one type of which is called “Speed”.

results.title: Speed of sound
results.creator_credit: Frank Wells, Gaumont-British Instructional and S.G. Fergusson
results.brief_description: Simple demonstrations are used to compare the speed of sound through air and through metal. Methods of determing the speed of sound in air, as determined by the French Academy Commission in 1738, and in water, as determined by Colladon and Sturm in Lake Geneva, are illustrated. Practical applications of the speed of sound are mentioned; the use of sound waves in echo sounding and depth plotting; sound ranging in gun location.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Frank Wells, Gaumont-British Instructional and S.G. Fergusson

results.title: Speed of chemical change
results.creator_credit: BFA Educational Media and Iwanama Productions
results.brief_description: This film discusses the factors that affect the speed of a chemical change. Models are used to illustrate the action of oxygen on carbon to produce carbon dioxide. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Speed for thespians
results.brief_description: On a busy New York City bus a man and a woman begin to argue. Their language is florid and slightly surreal. Very soon we become aware that what we are witnessing is a scene from Russian playwright Anton Chekhov. And very soon the rushed New York commuters are captivated by the performance unfolding in front of their jaded eyes. This innovative adaptation of Chekhov is a delirious celebration of film, theatre and urban life. Nominated for an Academy Award as Best Short Fiction Drama at the 2002 Academy Awards.

results.title: Speech skills: using your voice effectively
results.brief_description: In a television setting, pictures projected onto a screen change to live-action examples of situations where the effective use of your voice is important. Problems that are the result of the speaker’s volume, pitch, voice quality and articulation are examined, with suggestions for overcoming them.
